Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.ammo

Class AmmoCubes

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.ammo.AmmoCubes
  • public class AmmoCubes
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the game's currency. AmmoCubes come in three colours (red, yellow, blue). Players can individually hold only up to three cubes for each colour. Any further transaction that would lead to this rule being broken will be ignored, leaving the Player with still three cubes of the involved colour. A Player can also never be in debt of these, meaning negative values are not accepted.

                 int yellow,
                 int blue)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor allows to specify the amount of cubes for each individual colour.
        Parameters:
        red - the amount of red cubes
        yellow - the amount of yellow cubes
        blue - the amount of blue cubes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when trying to create an illegal number of cubes, such as beyond three, or a negative number.

      • sum

        public AmmoCubes sum​(AmmoCubes ammoCubes)
        This methods sums the values of two sets of AmmoCubes. The sum is evaluated on each colour individually and differently coloured cubes do not interfere with each other or with the final result. Should any of the colours end up having more than three cubes, the final result will be truncated to have at most that many.
        Parameters:
        ammoCubes - the other set of AmmoCubes that needs to be summed with the current set.
        Returns:
        a new object where each colour's amount is equal to the sum of that same colour's amounts in the addends, limited to three.

      • take

        public AmmoCubes take​(AmmoCubes ammoCubes)
               throws CannotAffordException
        This methods subtracts the values of a sets of AmmoCubes from the values of another set. The difference is evaluated on each colour individually and differently coloured cubes do not interfere with each other or with the final result. Should any of the colours end up having a negative number of cubes, the operation is aborted and an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        ammoCubes - the other set of AmmoCubes that needs to be subtracted from the current set.
        Returns:
        a new object where each colour's amount is equal to the difference between that same colour's amount in the object this method was called upon and that same colour's amount in the object passed as argument.
        Throws:
        CannotAffordException - when trying to take away more AmmoCubes than there actually are for at least one colour.

      • covers

        public boolean covers​(AmmoCubes cost)
        Tells if a set of AmmoCubes covers a cost expressed in AmmoCubes. The condition for coverage is having, for each colour, at least as many cubes of that colour as the cost.
        Parameters:
        cost - the cost to cover.
        Returns:
        whether or not the coverage condition is fulfilled.

      • augment

        public AmmoCubes augment​(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps)
        Combines the purchasing power of a set of AmmoCubes with that of a list of PowerUps. This is because each PowerUp translates into a single AmmoCubes of a specific colour.
        Parameters:
        powerUps - the PowerUps to add to the set of AmmoCubes.
        Returns:
        A new set of AmmoCubes equivalent to the combination of the current set with the list of PowerUps.

      • differenceFromCovering

        private AmmoCubes differenceFromCovering​(AmmoCubes cost)
        Tells how far a set of AmmoCubes is from being able to cover a cost, passed in as argument.
        Parameters:
        cost - the cost to cover.
        Returns:
        A set of AmmoCubes containing, for each colour, the minimum amount of AmmoCubes of that colour that would need to be added to the current set, in order to allow it to cover that cost.
        See Also:
        covers(AmmoCubes)

      • filterValidAugmenters

        public java.util.List<PowerUp> filterValidAugmenters​(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps,
                                                     AmmoCubes cost)
        Filters a list of PowerUps, allowing through only those PowerUps that, should the current set of AmmoCubes be augmented with, would reduce the difference from covering the cost passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        powerUps - the list of PowerUps from which to filter.
        cost - the cost to cover.
        Returns:
        the filtered list of PowerUps.
        See Also:
        augment(List), differenceFromCovering(AmmoCubes)

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object object)
        This method tells if two sets of AmmoCubes are worth the same. For this purpose, equal amounts of different colours are not comparable, implying that, in order for two instances of this class to be considered equivalent, they must have equal amounts of cubes for every colour.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - the set of AmmoCubes to compare with.
        Returns:
        whether or not the object this method was called upon is equivalent to the one passed as argument.

      • toStringAsColor

        public java.lang.String toStringAsColor()
        This methods is used to inspect a set of AmmoCubes containing exactly one cube.
        Returns:
        the name of the colour of the only cube in the set (or the empty string, if the usage criterion is not met).
